intro: Acrotriche depressa var. loddigesii, commonly known as the Loddiges' sandmat, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its fleshy, succulent stems and leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
